# (Unofficial) XboxAchievements.com Android App

Back in 2012 while in attending college, I started working on an Android application. The application was a version of the website [XboxAchievements.com](http://www.xboxachievements.com/) (Formerly known as x360achievements.org). 

### About XboxAchievements.com
[XA.com](http://www.xboxachievements.com/)  and sister site [playstationtrophies.org](http://www.playstationtrophies.org/) are well known sites within the video game community. These websites has almost, if not all Microsoft Games Achievements. Not only you can find game achievements but also latest news, screenshots, videos and much more. Even to this date these websites never had been mobile friendly. Since I was studying Software Development in college, I decided to create an Android version of the website and take on the challenge of learning Android Development.

### Idea #1
The main concept was to intergrade most of the main functionality from the website. Such as News, Game Information and Achievements. [XA.com](http://www.xboxachievements.com/) didn't have an API that I could of use and because of it, I had two approaches to accomplish my goals:

 1. [WebView](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/WebView.html) 
 2. [Web Scraping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_scraping)

I decided to go with the second option. First, I had to learn the basics of HTML. Next I had to learn Web Scraping in JAVA. I kind of had to learned HTML while working on the application. I used [JSoup](https://jsoup.org/) to the Web Scraping. After taking a couple Android tutorials online and knowing how to extract the data from the website, I build a simple Prototype.
 
[x360a Prototype (2013) - Video](https://www.youtube.com/embed/9Y4HtTGhc1Y)

I kept exclusively working on the application while attending school. I could say I spend around 6 hours daily working on the application and learning about Android. While working on the application, I kept asking for permission to use the website information for my application, but I was never contacted with an answer. About a year after of the initial prototype, I had released 6 alpha version in [XDA](https://www.xda-developers.com/) and [XA.com](http://www.xboxachievements.com/) forums.

Here is a video for [XA Alpha v0.0.6 (2014)](https://www.youtube.com/embed/qCvBWdGFEFQ)

### The second idea
After many tries to get permission from the website admins, I decided to stop development and shift focus to make a similar application. The new application would be less tied to [XA.com](http://www.xboxachievements.com/). Around the same time I had moved to Texas, USA and started studying Web Development. While studying Web Development, I started working on Xchievements application.

**Xchievements** focus on a social aspect to the game's achievements. User could leave comments in achievement asking for help or helping other users. So how **Xchievements** worked? If a user logged in, the information presented to the user came from my database. But if the user logged in as an admin, the user was presented with information coming from [XA.com](http://www.xboxachievements.com/). As an admin, the user could extract game information like achievements from [XA.com](http://www.xboxachievements.com/) and store it in my database, and then a normal user can see the information. I decided not to continue with this idea because the database I was using went out of bunisses. ([Parse](http://parseplatform.org/)) 
**NOTE: ** *The process described here might not be legal.* 

Here is video for Xchievements: [Xchievements Promo](https://www.youtube.com/embed/Sb2X2VhuPgY)

### Current Idea
Since stopping development for **Xchievements** until about a month ago, I have been an iPhone user and really haven't keep up with Android Apps or Development. Around a month ago I got me an Android phone and while searching Google Play Store I found this: [Guide for Xbox Achievements](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=it.michcorp.android.xboxachievementsguide&hl=en). Seeing this got me back into original idea. I rebooted **XA** Development with the intent of releasing the application. This time around the application will include all feature from the previous versions and more. 

Head over to the [XDA Thread](https://forum.xda-developers.com/android/apps-games/app-xa-unofficial-xboxachievements-com-t3600450) to tried the application and help me with feedbacks and suggestions. 

Thank You
